1494.question: Can the approach be generalized to other technical domains as well?

5-Figure3-1.png: The image shows a diagram of NMT decoding with technical term tokens and SMT technical term translation. It is not clear from the image whether the approach can be generalized to other technical domains as well, as there is no information provided about the specific technical domain or the nature of the technical terms being translated.
6-Figure4-1.png: The image shows a diagram of NMT rescoring of 1,000-best SMT translations with technical term tokens "TTi" (i = 1, 2,...). It is not clear from the image whether the approach can be generalized to other technical domains.
4-Figure2-1.png: Yes, the approach can be generalized to other technical domains as well. The key is to identify and replace technical term pairs with technical term tokens "TTi" (i = 1, 2,...) in the source and target sentences during NMT training. This will help improve the translation of technical terms across different domains.

1494.answer: There is no reason to think that this approach wouldn't also be successful for other technical domains. Technical terms are replaced with tokens, therefore so as long as there is a corresponding process for identifying and replacing technical terms in the new domain this approach could be viable.
